================================================================================
  FOR IMPLEMENTATION TEAMS (Week 1)
================================================================================

Making an Architectural Decision?
  
  1. Read: README.md (Architecture Decision section)
  2. Copy: ARCHITECTURE_DECISION.md
  3. Rename: ADR-001-[decision-name].md
  4. Complete all sections
  5. Get peer review
  
Include:
  - What choice was made
  - Why alternatives were rejected
  - Tradeoffs being accepted
  - Systems affected downstream
  - How we'll know if correct

ESTIMATED TIME: 1-2 hours per decision

================================================================================
  FOR PERFORMANCE TESTING
================================================================================

Running a Benchmark?
  
  1. Read: README.md (Performance Benchmark section)
  2. Copy: PERFORMANCE_BENCHMARK.md
  3. Rename: BENCH-001-[operation-name].md
  4. Fill with test setup and results
  5. Store baseline for regression detection

Include:
  - Exact test configuration
  - Results with units (ms, MB, ops/sec)
  - Bottleneck analysis
  - Optimization opportunities
  
ESTIMATED TIME: 1-2 hours per benchmark

================================================================================
  KEY FEATURES
================================================================================

All templates include:
  ✓ Executive summary (1-2 sentences)
  ✓ Clear recommendation/decision
  ✓ Comparison of alternatives
  ✓ Quantitative metrics and scores
  ✓ Risk assessment & mitigation
  ✓ Fallback/Plan B strategy
  ✓ Implementation guidance
  ✓ Monitoring/validation approach
  ✓ Completion checklist

Templates are designed to:
  ✓ Ensure consistency across Phase 1
  ✓ Save 30-50% time on documentation
  ✓ Enable peer review and approval
  ✓ Create historical records
  ✓ Support decision-making with data
  ✓ Enable regression detection

================================================================================
  EXAMPLE: FILLING A TEMPLATE
================================================================================

Step 1: Copy template
  $ cp SPIKE_1_HTML_PARSING_RESULTS.md spike1_goquery_results.md

Step 2: Open file and find [placeholders]
  Example:
    **Recommended Library**: [library name and version]
    
Step 3: Replace with real values
  Example:
    **Recommended Library**: goquery v1.8.1

Step 4: Complete all sections
  - Don't skip sections (explain why if N/A)
  - Include real performance numbers
  - Justify recommendations with data
  - Define fallback strategy

Step 5: Complete checklist
  - All [placeholders] replaced
  - Numbers include units
  - Key decision clearly stated
  - Fallback/Plan B specified
  - Monitoring approach defined

Step 6: Get peer review and commit to git

================================================================================
  TEMPLATE STRUCTURE
================================================================================

SPIKE RESULTS (Spike 1 & 3):
  1. Executive summary
  2. Library evaluation (candidates, pros/cons)
  3. Performance metrics
  4. Accuracy metrics
  5. Known limitations
  6. Production recommendations
  7. Fallback strategy
  8. Implementation checklist

ARCHITECTURE DECISION (ADR):
  1. Decision statement
  2. Context and goals
  3. Options evaluated
  4. Chosen option
  5. Rationale
  6. Tradeoffs
  7. Implications
  8. Implementation plan
  9. Monitoring & validation
  10. Approval & sign-off

PERFORMANCE BENCHMARK:
  1. Operation being tested
  2. Test setup (system & data config)
  3. Results (timing, memory, throughput)
  4. Analysis (bottlenecks, recommendations)
  5. Regression baselines
  6. Optimization opportunities
  7. Raw data appendix
